content:
Something I noticed while working in another language in VSCode: RA isn't flagging unused vars / use statements, at least not without having also run cargo check. VSCode handles it through the DiagnosticsTag API instead of the semantic highlighting API, so perhaps this is why it isn't showing up for me (since my codebase isn't cargo-compatible, and we're using rust-project.json).

I've found where we publish the Unnecessary diagnostic here: https://github.com/rust-analyzer/rust-analyzer/blob/661e3f933ab359ecafe2d10ab8b1d1da0d7fe5fc/crates/rust-analyzer/src/handlers.rs#L1311

But not if we're doing any detection of it in the semantic parsing.

Is this only generated by running rustc to do a check-compile?
Ye we do not have our own dead code diagnostics yet, so we currently rely on the check diagnostics for this
